name: WooCommerce Additional Fees On Checkout (Free)
author: WPSuperiors

sections.description:
WooCommerce Additional Fees On Checkout plugin allows to create required or non-required multiple fees on checkout page to apply an fixed or percentage cost upon cart total quantity, Individual product, Cart total amount, Product category, Product type.

Introduction

Want to charge extra cost for additonal services? or Handling fees?

In one words, WooCommerce Additional Fees plugin makes it very simple.

WooCommerce Additional Fees plugin built to integrate seamlessly with WordPress WooCommerce, that gives store owners complete control to adjust Labels, amount, percentage or fixed price calculation etc.

Compatible with 99% of all leading woocommerce theme layouts including OceanWP, Astra, Zoa, Tesseract, Avada, BeTheme, FlatSome, Enfold and many more themes.

Play the settings from, WooCommerce > Additional Fees.

DEMO

Frontend Checkout Page

Backend Settings Page

Features at a glance

  • Enable/Disable the fee/cost.
  • Add custom label for checkout page.
  • Add custom label for order history, billing details etc.
  • Applicable amount type
    — Fixed
    — Percentage.
  • Add amount.( support decimal amount )
  • Auto checked / auto-applied fee/cost.
  • Conditions to apply amount.
    — Each individual Product basis.
    — Based on Cart Total Amount Basis(Max/Min).
    — Based on Number of Product available in Cart(Max/Min).
  • Set your fee to include TAX amount.
  • Set your fee to include Shipping charges.
  • Woocommerce additional fees amount details available at order details page at admin end as well as customer My Account end.
  • Set your fee to charge the amount multiplied by the product quantity by using ‘Multiplied By Product Quantity’ from ‘Apply Condition’ dropdown.
  • Set your fee to charge the amount for one time by using ‘One Time Only’ from ‘Apply Condition’ dropdown.
  • Option to Auto-checked/Auto-applied the fees at checkout page.
  • Add unlimited number of woocommerce additional fee/cost for checkout page.
  • Add CSS.

To Know more please visit WooCommerce Additional Fees On Checkout

Keep in mind, the amount you set is always effected only on cart subtotal at checkout page.

N.B: Please activate WooCommerce before you activate WooCommerce Additional Fees plugin, and both Free and Premium version will not activate at the same time. Please deactivate one version before you going to activate another version.
Not all the features are avaiable at the free version, to get the full features please check it out Pro version.

Let’s check it out.
sections.installation:
Minimum Requirements

  • WooCommerce 2.6 requires WordPress 4.4+

Automatic installation

Automatic installation is the easiest option as WordPress handles the file transfers itself and you don’t need to leave your web browser. To do an automatic install of WooCommerce, log in to your WordPress dashboard, navigate to the Plugins menu and click Add New.

In the search field type “WooCommerce Additional Fees On Checkout” and click Search Plugins. Once you’ve found our plugin.You can install it by simply clicking “Install Now”.
And activate it.
*Keep In Mind, Before activating “WooCommerce Additional Fees On Checkout” activate “WooCommerce”

Manual installation

The manual installation method involves downloading our plugin and uploading it to your webserver via your favourite FTP application. The WordPress codex contains instructions on how to do this here.

  1. Upload the plugin files to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory, or install the plugin through the WordPress plugins screen directly.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ screen in WordPress
  3. Goto WooCommerce->Additional Fees, and play with settings.

sections.reviews:
Not that bad

By tleshotho on April 7, 2024

The free version is usable to an extent. Great plugin if you are just looking for something really simple, for any additional settings you will need to cough up a few bucks for the premium version.

Bon plugin

By kazam567 on November 21, 2022

Après avoir acheté le plugin celui-ci est bien actif et visible mais non fonctionnel. De multiples relances au support afin de trouver une solution et finalement une réponse très tardive mais qui a permis de résoudre le problème. Bon plugin une fois fonctionnel !!

Worst Experience

By wpvirtuoso on August 28, 2022

You can create only one label which you cannot change, only fee can be added in the free version so what is the use for?

Useless

By Tawhid Islam Raihan (raihan143) on May 15, 2022

Just fun!!! It doesn't work.

WARNING: No Refunds

By cormip on May 11, 2022

The only way to fully test the plugin is to purchase the Premium version. After discovering it will not do what you want, you're stuck. WPSuperiors does not issue refunds under any circumstances. Customer Support was extremely rude in their response to my refund request. The plugin "Checkout Field Editor for WooCommerce" by ThemeHigh ended up being able to do everything I wanted, and their support was super-responsive in addressing an issue I had encountered.

Great support

By flyingkites on May 6, 2022

The plugin did not work as expected for me. After reporting the issue to the developers they worked with me to fix it. It did take some time to complete the fix but they did what they promised with patience and professionalism. I would not hesitate to buy their Pro version should I ever need it.

Excellent Support

By jonhowcroft on October 18, 2021

Not a free plugin, but does exactly what we needed it to (accept donations for charity at checkout). There was one small issue and the support team resolved it swiftly. Tried a few other plugins first, this is the best one for our requirements

Useless

By (dan1165) on September 13, 2021

Would love to give this zero stars. Marketed as a free plugin, but unable to use any features without purchasing their "premium version". Exactly the type of vendor that woocommerce doesn't need.

Free version should be called DEMO version

By cathbland on September 7, 2021

You cannot change the field label on free version, so you are not offering a free version, you are offering a demo version for users to check that the plugin works on their site but not use unless they purchase. It is not a useful plugin if the label is locked to "Unlabelled Fees by WPSuperiors.com (optional)" and changing this label requires purchase.

free version is useless

By alexandrecrespo on June 28, 2021

how can buy if is untested, how can I test if free version is useless?
